english: government official; public office; officialdom; organ (TCM)

etymology.description: ideogrammic: 宀 + 𠂤 — multiple rooms under a roof, an official building.
etymology.interpretation: A roof placed over a cluster of rooms evokes a government office or administrative building. From that image, the word extended to mean officials, officialdom, and related institutional senses.

examples.chinese: 他不愿涉足官场(他不願涉足官場)。
examples.english: He is unwilling to step into officialdom.

examples.chinese: 在中医里(在中醫裡)，肝被称为将军之官(肝被稱為將軍之官)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngyī lǐ, gān bèi chēngwéi jiāngjūn zhī guān.
examples.english: In traditional Chinese medicine, the liver is called the organ of the general.
